Original_Text: LONDON - British Airways announced a new cost-cutting initiative, aiming to reduce operational expenses by 15% over the next two years.
TOKYO - Japan's central bank decided to maintain current interest rates, citing stable economic growth despite global uncertainties.
NEW YORK - The stock market saw a slight uptick as investors reacted positively to the latest corporate earnings reports.
BEIJING - China unveiled plans to expand its renewable energy sector, targeting a 20% increase in solar and wind capacity by 2030.
PARIS - French authorities negotiated a ceasefire in a regional conflict, aiming to stabilize the volatile area.
SYDNEY - Australian regulators approved a merger between two major mining companies, boosting shares in the resource sector.
BAGHDAD - Iraqi officials reported progress in peace talks with local militia groups, aiming to reduce violence in key regions.
SAN FRANCISCO - A major tech firm announced a breakthrough in quantum computing, potentially revolutionizing data processing.
MOSCOW - Russia increased its oil exports despite international sanctions, causing a dip in global crude prices.
BRUSSELS - EU leaders discussed new trade agreements to strengthen economic ties with Asian markets.
